title: French elections: Left wins most seats, ahead of Macron's coalition and far right
summary: According to final results, the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance won 182 seats in France's Assemblée Nationale, ahead of Macron's coalition (168) and the far-right Rassemblement National (143).

title: French elections: On the left, the Socialists win almost as many seats as Mélenchon's LFI
summary: Estimated results show the left-wing alliance leading after the second round of France's parliamentary elections, though far from having an absolute majority. The Socialists are set to double their numbers, rising to rival the formerly dominant La France Insoumise.

title: French elections: Macron's camp, projected to come in second, avoids a major defeat
summary: The presidential Ensemble coalition is projected to win between 152 and 158 seats in the Palais-Bourbon, according to estimates by the Ipsos Talan institute.

title: French elections: Far-right RN party obtains large group, but falls far from goal of absolute majority
summary: The far right has been beaten by the coalition of the left, but the Rassemblement National party could still represent the largest group of MPs in the Assemblée Nationale.

title: 2024 French elections: Map and chart of second-round results
summary: French voters returned to the polls on Sunday, July 7, to elect a new Assemblée Nationale and determine who will be in a position to govern France. See how many seats each party won and the district-by-district map.

title: French PM Attal offers to resign after Macron's coalition loses majority
summary: With no clear majority in the Assemblée Nationale, Gabriel Attal may stay in office while negotiations on forming a new government take place.

title: Joe Biden dropped by major Hollywood donors
summary: More and more film industry figures, such as Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings, have called on the US president to pass the torch to another Democratic candidate in the race for the White House.

title: Modi visits Moscow for the first time since the start of the war in Ukraine
summary: The Indian Prime Minister, who takes a dim view of China's rapprochement with Russia, is seeking to reassure the latter of the importance of their partnership.

title: Persistent heat wave in the US shatters new records, causing deaths in the West
summary: Las Vegas on Sunday set a new all-time record high of 119 F (48.3 C), while a motorcyclist died Saturday from heat exposure in Death Valley, California.

title: French elections: Former president François Hollande elected to Parliament
summary: Hollande, who had been president when Macron emerged onto France's political scene, won a majority of votes cast in his constituency, running against both the far-right Rassemblement National candidate and incumbent right-wing MP Francis Dubois.

title: French elections: Former conservative leader Wauquiez returns to Parliament
summary: The president of the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region came out ahead of the far-right RN candidate Alexandre Heuzey, in the 1st constituency of Haute-Loire, where Wauquiez has already served as MP twice.

title: French election: Former prime minister Elisabeth Borne re-elected
summary: Borne, who saw through the controversial pension reform, was re-elected with 56.37% of the vote in her Normandy constituency, ahead of the far-right candidate.

title: French elections: Marine Le Pen's sister beaten
summary: Marie-Caroline Le Pen, the sister of French far-right leader Marine Le Pen, was beaten by a left-wing candidate.

title: EU foreign policy chief issues fresh rebuke to Hungary's Orban
summary: The Hungarian Prime Minister, whose country took over the EU's rotating presidency this month, attended a meeting of the Organization of Turkic States in Azerbaijan on Saturday. 'Hungary has not received any mandate from the EU Council to advance the relations' with this organization, Josep Borrell said in a statement.

title: Why do we forget our earliest memories?
summary: The first years of life are generally inaccessible to our adult memory. Neuroscience explores this intriguing 'infantile amnesia,' revisiting a concept coined by Sigmund Freud.

title: Controversial right-wing party leader Eric Ciotti announces his re-election in parliamentary elections
summary: Eric Ciotti, whose decision to ally with the far-right RN party led to his Les Républicain party tearing itself apart, announced his re-election on X, beating left-wing candidate Olivier Salerno and presidential coalition candidate Graig Monetti.

title: Tour de France: Frenchman Turgis wins stage 8 on gravel roads
summary: Anthony Turgis won after a long breakaway, while Tadej Pogacar attacked several times but couldn't get the better of Jonas Vingegaard and Remco Evenepoel.

title: German population census reveals some surprises
summary: The results of the survey, which took place from May 2022 to January 2023, have sparked surprise. Almost 2 million homes are vacant across the country.

title: French elections: LFI dissenter François Ruffin narrowly re-elected
summary: Ruffin, who fell out with Jean-Luc Mélenchon and the La France Insoumise party during the campaign, was elected with 51.21% of the vote in a tough contest against the far right.

title: At the NATO summit, Europeans appear vulnerable and divided in the face of the US
summary: The setbacks of Emmanuel Macron's and Olaf Scholz's parties in the European elections, differences with the US over Russia and the prospect of Donald Trump's return to the White House have left the EU countries in a weak position before the Alliance summit.

title: Melvyn Jaminet suspended by French rugby federation after racist remark in viral video
summary: In a statement, the French rugby federation (FFR) condemned the comments as 'unacceptable and contrary to the fundamental values of our sport.'

title: Germany's ruling coalition has reached an agreement on a budget for the next five years
summary: After intense negotiations, the alliance led by Chancellor Olaf Scholz has agreed on a plan for 2025, aimed above all at boosting sluggish growth.

title: French elections: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin re-elected in stronghold
summary: Darmanin, who had said he intended to leave President Emmanuel Macron's government after the elections, announced having won in his northern French stronghold, beating the far-right Rassemblement National party candidate.

title: French elections: The left-wing coalition is at the forefront of an unprecedented political situation
summary: Having come out on top in the second round, the alliance is challenged to dialogue with other political forces in order to convert its first place into a governing majority.

title: French elections: European leaders express relief after blow to far right
summary: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez hailed France's 'rejection of the far right', while Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the result would lead to 'disappointment' in Russia and 'relief' in Ukraine.
